{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3524265,"name":"Bradley Chumanov","username":"NukeMinecart","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T00:56:25.301Z","cooked":"

We recently had to replace a Neo on our swerve drive after an encoder wire broke, and now that module sometimes doesn’t align with the others. It is off by and inconsistent amount, and the encoder knows that it’s off but doesn’t correct for it immediately. We have tried changing the PID of all of our angle motors, but this does not fix our issue. The module should be aligned with the others

We are using MK4 swerve modules and YAGSL for the code.
Our code: GitHub - team1306/Robot2025

Does anyone know why this might be happening?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T00:56:25.301Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":87.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":491290,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-not-aligning-with-others","display_username":"Bradley Chumanov","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/team1306/Robot2025","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - team1306/Robot2025","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69694,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1306 Co-President"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-not-aligning-with-others/491290/1","custom_user_title":"1306 Co-President","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3524267,"name":"Val","username":"Otter502","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/otter502/{size}/245799_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T00:59:33.522Z","cooked":"
NukeMinecart:

the encoder knows that it’s off

Is this the cancoder or the relative encoder? Because you might be running into an issue where the cancoder’s offset is correct while the relative encoder (which was on the motor) is now incorrect.
(This might not be the issue but that’s what I’d check first since you replaced the motor)

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T00:59:33.522Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":59,"readers_count":58,"score":21.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":491290,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-not-aligning-with-others","display_username":"Val","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63596,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-not-aligning-with-others/491290/2","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3524272,"name":"Bradley Chumanov","username":"NukeMinecart","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T01:01:46.401Z","cooked":"

Our absolute encoder knows it is wrong. (We are using a thrifty mag encoder).

Eventually, after forcing it to drive a direction, the module will go the correct direction, but it doesn’t do it immediately. I also thought YAGSL would rezero the internal motor encoder.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T01:01:46.401Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":15.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491290,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-not-aligning-with-others","display_username":"Bradley Chumanov","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63596,"username":"Otter502","name":"Val","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/otter502/{size}/245799_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69694,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1306 Co-President"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-not-aligning-with-others/491290/3","custom_user_title":"1306 Co-President","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3524275,"name":"Val","username":"Otter502","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/otter502/{size}/245799_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T01:07:18.345Z","cooked":"

I believe yagsl does, I just wanted to double check,

Here is some flowcharts from the docs that can be really helpful when debugging; Flowcharts | YAGSL

Was it a drive or angle motor that you replaced?
Did you remeasure the offset for the absolute encoder (just in case? It shouldn’t be an issue if the cancoder knows it’s off)
Did you change anything else (gear ratios / factors / etc)

We replaced our angle motor, and we rezeroed our absolute encoder, so that shouldn’t be an issue. I don’t think the flowcharts are of much help after looking at them.

do you have a video on advantage scope or of the chassis itself?
It might be helpful to see how different the module is from the others (especially when the angle setpoint changes)

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T01:10:27.009Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":36,"readers_count":35,"score":12.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491290,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-not-aligning-with-others","display_username":"Val","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69694,"username":"NukeMinecart","name":"Bradley Chumanov","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63596,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-not-aligning-with-others/491290/6","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3524318,"name":"Bradley Chumanov","username":"NukeMinecart","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T01:49:57.126Z","cooked":"

It was a little hard to get the video uploaded. Let me know if you can’t view it.

drive.google.com

WIN_20250211_19_39_21_Pro.mp4

Google Drive file.

The module not working is the one on the close right (oscillates more than the others)

@nstrike is fairly active here on CD and has a good amount of experience with yagsl (this is an understatement).
I’m not familiar enough with yagsl to help but there are a ton of people here who should be able to help!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T01:53:59.298Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":29,"readers_count":28,"score":10.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":491290,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-not-aligning-with-others","display_username":"Val","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69694,"username":"NukeMinecart","name":"Bradley Chumanov","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63596,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-not-aligning-with-others/491290/8","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3524520,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T06:06:07.604Z","cooked":"

You should enable module auto synchronization for now. I am going to push an update to fix this that delays startup by 8 seconds in the near future but enabling auto synchronization rn will fix your problem.

The root of the problem is an undocumented known issue with DutyCycleEncoders having incorrect readings on the RIO for the first 2 seconds.
